pl.cnf

Class CNFConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.cnf.CNFConverter

  • public class CNFConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a static method for converting a Sentence of propositional logic to conjunctive normal form (CNF).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static boolean TRACE 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CNFConverter() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.Set<Clause> convert(KB kb)
      Convert a KB (set of Sentences) to clauses and return the Set of Clauses.
      static java.util.Set<Clause> convert(Sentence s)
      Convert the given Sentence to conjunctive normal form (CNF) and return the resulting Set of Clauses (disjunctions of literals).
      protected static Sentence distributeOrOverAnd(Sentence s)
      Distribute OR over AND and return the resulting Sentence.
      protected static Sentence eliminateBiconditionals(Sentence s)
      Remove biconditionals from the given Sentence (replacing them with one-way implications) and return the new Sentence.
      protected static Sentence eliminateImplications(Sentence s)
      Remove implications from the given Sentence (replacing them with a disjunction) and return the new Sentence.
      protected static Sentence moveNegationInwards(Sentence s)
      Move negations in as far as possible in the given Sentence and return the result.
      protected static Sentence negate(Sentence s)
      Return the negation of the given Sentence, assuming it doesn't contain any biconditionals or implications.
      protected static java.util.Set<Clause> splitIntoClauses(Sentence s)
      At this point we have a conjunction of clauses, which we break into individual clauses and return the set.
      protected static void splitIntoClauses(Sentence s, java.util.Set<Clause> clauses)
      Split given Sentence into clauses, accumulating them in the given Set.

    • Field Detail

      • TRACE

        protected static boolean TRACE

    • Constructor Detail

      • CNFConverter

        public CNFConverter()

    • Method Detail

      • convert

        public static java.util.Set<Clause> convert(Sentence s)
        Convert the given Sentence to conjunctive normal form (CNF) and return the resulting Set of Clauses (disjunctions of literals). Note that the result may share structure with the input.

      • eliminateBiconditionals

        protected static Sentence eliminateBiconditionals(Sentence s)
        Remove biconditionals from the given Sentence (replacing them with one-way implications) and return the new Sentence.

      • eliminateImplications

        protected static Sentence eliminateImplications(Sentence s)
        Remove implications from the given Sentence (replacing them with a disjunction) and return the new Sentence.

      • moveNegationInwards

        protected static Sentence moveNegationInwards(Sentence s)
        Move negations in as far as possible in the given Sentence and return the result. Essentially, this means that if the given sentence is a NOT of a compound sentence (AND, OR, or a quantified sentence), then move the negation in.

      • negate

        protected static Sentence negate(Sentence s)
        Return the negation of the given Sentence, assuming it doesn't contain any biconditionals or implications.

      • distributeOrOverAnd

        protected static Sentence distributeOrOverAnd(Sentence s)
        Distribute OR over AND and return the resulting Sentence.

      • splitIntoClauses

        protected static java.util.Set<Clause> splitIntoClauses(Sentence s)
        At this point we have a conjunction of clauses, which we break into individual clauses and return the set.

      • splitIntoClauses

        protected static void splitIntoClauses(Sentence s,
                                       java.util.Set<Clause> clauses)
        Split given Sentence into clauses, accumulating them in the given Set.

      • convert

        public static java.util.Set<Clause> convert(KB kb)
        Convert a KB (set of Sentences) to clauses and return the Set of Clauses. For anything more than a small KB, you would be better off writing this yourself so that you can monitor progress and also an appropriate Set implementation to gather the results.
